qas.question: What was the bureau's first task?

answers.text: visiting and making surveys of the houses of prostitution

qas.question: What act was the bureau initially tasked with enforcing?
What was the other formal name of the Mann Act?
When was the Mann Act passed?
What did the bureau visit during its last official task?
What was the last law that the FBI enforced?
When was the Mann Act rejected by congress?
What year was the Division of Investigation renamed the United States Bureau of Investigation?
When was the FBI separated from the Department of Justice?

context: The bureau's first official task was <a0_0>visiting and making surveys of the <b5_0>houses of prostitution<b5_0/><a0_0/> in preparation for enforcing the "<a1_0><a2_0><b6_0>White Slave Traffic Act<b6_0/><a2_0/><a1_0/>," or Mann Act, passed on <a3_0><b7_0>June 25, 1910<b7_0/><a3_0/>. <a4_0>In <b8_0>1932<b8_0/>,<a4_0/> it was renamed the United States Bureau of Investigation. The following year it was linked to the Bureau of Prohibition and rechristened the Division of Investigation (DOI) before finally becoming an independent service within the Department of Justice in <b9_0>1935<b9_0/>. In the same year, its name was officially changed from the Division of Investigation to the present-day Federal Bureau of Investigation, or FBI.
